item.description: Warm up with this hearty beef stew that'll fill your home with incredible aromas! Full of tender beef, colorful veggies, and aromatic herbs, this dish is a go-to for cozy nights. Great for family dinners or gatherings. Don't forget to pin this for later!

â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 120 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 pounds beef chuck, cut into bite-sized pieces
  • 4 cups beef broth (homemade or store-bought)
  • 3 large carrots, sliced
  • 3 potatoes, diced
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 teaspoon dried rosemary
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 cup frozen peas
  • 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef chunks and brown them on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Seriously, don't overcrowd the pot or they won't brown right.
  2. Remove the beef and set it aside. In the same pot, add the chopped onion and garlic, cooking until they're fragrant and the onion is translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
  3. Stir in the tomato paste, thyme, and rosemary. Let that simmer for a minute, then return the beef to the pot.
  4. Pour in the beef broth and add the carrots and potatoes. Bring everything to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and let it simmer for about 1.5 hours. You'll know it's ready when the beef is super tender.
  5. In the last 15 minutes, add the frozen peas and Worcestershire sauce. If it seems thick, add a little more broth or water.
  6. Serve hot in bowls, maybe with some crusty bread on the side. Your kitchen will smell amazing!
